thread.title: NJ HS football player strikes player in head with helmet
thread.title_full: NJ HS football player strikes player in head with helmet - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: NJ HS football player strikes player in head with helmet
text:
Believe it or not, Pacman Jones was not involved in the dirtiest play of the weekend.
During a New Jersey high school football game between Immaculata High School and Linden High School, a defensive lineman from Linden ripped the helmet off an Immaculata offensive lineman and swung the helmet across the Immaculata player’s head.
The Immaculata player left the game and was taken to Morristown Memorial Hospital where he was treated for a contusion and received 10 stitches, according to mycentraljersey.com.
The incident resulted in an unsportsmanlike conduct penalty, but the Linden player was not ejected from the game.
 SPORTS ON FACEBOOK. "LIKE" US HERE.
Youtube A Linden player pulls the helmet off an Immaculata player. Youtube The Linden player strikes the Immaculata player with a helmet. Previous Next Enlarge Immaculata High School Athletics Director Tom Gambino said the referees must have not seen the player get hit with the helmet.
“Obviously this is very serious,” Gambino told mycentraljersey.com. “When you see it on film, it’s like ‘oh my God.’ Obviously the officials didn’t see it. If he did, I’m sure he would have walked the kid to the Linden sideline. These are good guys (officials). That’s not the point here. It’s hard to believe they didn’t see it. But, come on. If you see that, you have to think that he would have been led off the field.”
Gambino did say he received an apology from Linden school officials but is still “waiting for answers” before determining whether or not to pursue charges.
